titleStmt.title: By the King: a proclamation. James R. Whereas Richard Duke of Tyrconnel, before our coming into this our kingdom, did cause several servicable horses to be taken and seized upon for mounting of troops of horse and dragoons for our service, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at the Kings printinghouse on Ormonde-Key, and the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at Dublin castle the 14th day of June, 1689.".
Richard, Duke of Tyrconnel, seized several serviceable horses ... Thry are to be given up at once. Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
